result.execSummary:
The defendant Leandre Lashon Hazelwood was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: With credit for 3 DAYS time served, concurrent with any other sentence.

miscConds.notes:
*06-29-2022/Rest. Hearing - Court orders restitution set to zero.
Restitution held open pending hearing on June 29, 2022.

- The Court ordered the defendant to pay applicable costs, surcharges, fees, and assessments over period of probation. Upon successful completion or revocation, any balance remaining unpaid is to be converted to a civil judgment against the defendant.

- Trauma screen assessment and cooperate with any treatment.
- Cooperate with any other treatment Department deems appropriate.
- Provide DNA sample.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Leandre Lashon Hazelwood in court with attorney Lori Ann Kuehn.  Samuel Tufford appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Leandre Lashon Hazelwood appeared by video means with Attorney.  Based on statements of counsel, court orders restitution set to zero.  No further hearings necessary.  kmw

Defendant Leandre Lashon Hazelwood in court with attorney Lori Ann Kuehn.  Samuel Tufford appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Statements made as to sentencing.

The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 90 days in the House of Correction, with credit for 3 DAYS time served, concurrent with any other sentence.  This sentence is STAYED and defendant placed on PROBATION for a period of 18 months
  
Terms of Probation:
Trauma screen assessment and cooperate with any treatment
Cooperate with any other treatment Department deems appropriate

The Court ordered the defendant to pay applicable costs, surcharges, fees, and assessments over period of probation.  Upon successful completion or revocation, any balance remaining unpaid is to be converted to a civil judgment against the defendant

Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Post-conviction Relief.  kmw
********************
Restitution held open pending hearing on June 29, 2022, 8:30 via Zoom.
Attorney Lori Ann Kuehn via Zoom Jack T Eichorst appeared via Zoom for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Kuehn in trial br 15.  Sentencing rescheduled to June 1, 2022, 1:30 room 502SB.  kmw

Actual Date Bond Posted with  the Sheriffs Department:
02/08/22.    22RM007411

Actual Date Bond Posted with  the Sheriffs Department:
02/08/22.    22RM007410
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 3/29/22 @ 1p
Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights & Addendum to Plea, filed.

Plea Hearing proceeded. Parties have reached a resolution. State placed negotiations on the record. Defense counsel and defendant confirms. 

AS TO COUNT 1: Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea. Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived her rights.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 

Case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 34. Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 17, 2022 at 09:45 am in Room 502SB.

Defendant Leandre Lashon Hazelwood in court with attorney Lori Ann Kuehn.  Elizabeth A Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Ashley, Branch 19.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney. Defendant plead not guilty.  Case is heard in Br. 34 for a global resolution.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 17, 2022 at 09:45 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
